campaign.story:
Coral Island is a re-imagined farm sim game inspired by classics. Grow crops, nurture animals, and befriend the islanders. Decide whether to revitalize not only the town but also the surrounding coral reefs.  
Promising to keep intact what makes classic farm sim games fun, Coral Island aims to modernize and make the experience more inclusive. We feature a large cast of diverse characters and weave environmental awareness into the core game loop —  all the while keeping it a wholesome good time.


There are over 50 islanders living on Coral Island. Coming from all walks of life, get to know these people by chatting them up — extra brownie points for gifts!

Transform your overrun land into a lush and lively farm. Find your play style by deciding what crops to grow, which animals to nurture, or what structures to build.
Choose from a variety of crops, flowers, fruit plants, and trees. There are over 75 plantables in the game, ranging from age-old classics to the exotic and obscure native to Asia.
Crops are seasonal, which means they only grow in a specific season. However, some crops can be planted in multiple seasons and be re-harvested every several days. 
Fruit plants take 11 days to mature. They are bi-seasonal, able to grow 2 seasons out of the year, and will wither offseason. Does not need to be watered after maturity.
Fruit Trees take 28 days to mature and will not wither off-season. They bear 1 fruit a day, every day for the season, and will continue to bear fruit every year.

Make a living by caring for animals and raising livestock. Though you'll first need to build a coop or barn to house them! These farm animals can be left outside during the day and will return inside as night falls.


Poultry are farm animals that live in a coop. If fed daily, mature poultry usually produces 1 egg, and sometimes, a feather.

Barn-dwelling animals range from the traditional Sheep and Cow to Luwak and Llamas. They need to be brushed and fed daily to keep their produce flowing.

Dive into the ocean to restore the coral reefs! Select a diving spot around the island, and unlock deeper levels to explore. Unravel all that the ocean has to offer.
Clean up the sea bed to make a home for rare fish, and collect ocean kelp to hone the quality of livestock and crop.
Bring processed kelp to Ling's Lab to permanently upgrade the quality of your products. Decide which you'll upgrade first: seeds, saplings, seedlings, fodder, or bait.
16 singles and ready to mingle. Sweep them off their feet and find the one. Find out what their personalities are like, take them on a date, and fall in love!
 Unlock various relationship scenes and when you're ready, build a life together at the farm — perhaps even have children. Yes, no, maybe?
Go deep into the caverns to mine precious gemstones — use the loot to upgrade your tools and farm. But beware, monsters protect rare finds so bring a weapon or two!
Packed with a variety of outfits, accessories, and options to choose from, you are armed with plenty of styles to express yourself. Conform to the community or be different! There is no wrong answer because there is only one you in Coral Island.
Select 1 out of 3 starter houses. Upgrade, decorate… personalize! Purchase furniture, collect paintings and display exclusive decorations. Welcome home, Farmer.
Catch a variety of fish, starfish, and squid! There are also crabs at the beach. Fun fact! Several freshwater and saltwater fish can only be caught at specific seasons or certain times (i.e: at summer dawn, or rainy winters).
Coral Island was once home to an expansive variety of aquatic life. As you restore the island's ecosystem, more types of fish will be available to catch. Perhaps, you'll even cross paths with something legendary?
Level up! As you make your way around the island, you will earn skill points that can be invested into skills. 
Decide on a path and create an experience unique to you. Along the way, you'll unlock new, exciting techniques that might come in handy on the farm!
Get busy and immerse yourself in Coral Island! You can pick projects to work on or a fun skill to develop in your free time... or not. Your time, your choice. Here are some of the additional features in Coral Island worth noting.
Improve the town: Take part in community projects to build and liven up the town. Spare some extra gold to add a community garden for the locals or build a brand new museum and more…
Festivals: Join the local community in a Cherry Blossom Festival, annual beach clean up, and many more. There are 2 festivals each season that you can participate in.
Pets: Choose a companion. Decide between a dog, cat, monkey, fox & more! Your pet will play around the farm and come inside the house.
Weather & Time: The forecast includes sun, wind, rain, storm, and snow. Coral Island also features a day and night cycle with dynamic lighting.  Set the pace by adjusting the passage of time with a time slider.
Cooking: Build a kitchen and start cooking. With over 70 recipes to learn, including Popiah, Lodeh, and Cauliflower Casserole. Gather all cooking utensils and try them all.
Quests: Embark on adventures! There are elaborate quests that will give you cutscenes and storylines, and there are simple quests. Rack up relationship points and get paid!


Welcome to your new home, a small town with big personalities called Starlet Town. It's located on the coast of Coral Island. This tropical island features a setting loosely influenced by Southeast Asia. You'll see this come across the lore, world-building, crops, animals, and more. Nestled in between the equator and northern tropic, Coral Island is graced by four seasons per year.

This is Coral Island. Segmented into 7 different areas, your farm is located on the left side of the map, just on the outskirts of town.
 Starlet Town is the heart of Coral Island. Not only is it roomy and features a butterfly garden, but this charming little town also has stories hidden behind its townies.
The Beach is rich with sparkly white sands, seashells, and seasonal fruits. On the pier sits a handsome old Inn and a gateway to ocean exploration, the Diving spot. 
The Lake perhaps guards the most magical place in Coral Island. Find your way through the wooden bridge and discover the ancient temple. It’s believed to be the main source of water and where the island's rich soil originates from.
The Forest is a mystic sanctuary for wildlife, filled with ruins and who-knows-what. Underneath the musky floor, it's a hoarding place for messages from the past, the Cavern.
The Lookout used to be a place where locals prepared for battles of old and whatnot. As time passed, the Lighthouse is now solely used for navigational aid. Come here and enjoy wicked sunsets and pick some wild fruits on your way home.
The Woodlands used to be part of the Forest, but since the arrival of humans, it is now tamed and family-friendly, without losing its green allure. Walk alongside the river to see the School, Taco Truck, and houses belong to those who prefer quiet nights over paved pathways of the town.
 Hillside, sandwiched between the Forest and Woodlands, is the perfect combination of green and privacy. Take a peek at the Vineyard and familiarize yourself with the local Carpenters.

The Coral Three were said to be the Goddess of Flowers, Merfolk, and Giants. Once upon a time, they worked together to maintain the balance of Coral Island. 
The Goddess of Flowers was worshipped by both Merfolk and Giants. To this day, locals continue to believe that the Goddess is responsible for rejuvenating the island's water, soil, and well-being.
Submerged artifacts suggest The Merfolk Kingdom protected the oceans. It appears they were tasked with ruling the underwater world around Coral Island, making sure that order was maintained.
Legend has it The Kingdom of Giants existed to cultivate the rich soil of Coral Island. Ruins around the island depict Giants, and what appear to be humans, farming alongside one another.

Pufferfish Drilling Corp. is a disgraced company whose goal is to drill oil on and around Coral Island. Set to open this Spring, they plan to lobby their way into the community and collect properties to secure voting rights.

The current plan is to release Coral Island for Steam on the Windows platform first. Since we've passed our Console Stretch Goals, Coral Island will also be coming to Nintendo Switch, Playstation, and Xbox! 

We understand that localization is very important. Coral Island will launch into early access with Bahasa Indonesia and English support. Shortly after, we will update the game to support the additional 8 languages seen below.
Based in Indonesia, our team currently consists of 20 passionate talents. This includes both permanent crew members and remote collaborators. Although this is our first game as a studio, our team is comprised of veteran and junior game developers.
You can learn more about us on our website: www.stairwaygames.com

Our goal is to release the best version of Coral Island. We believe the only way to achieve this is through community involvement. With Kickstarter, we hope to build a community of passionate backers and involve you all in the process of development. All in service of producing the best farming game we can create.  
So far, development has been entirely self-funded. Although we have enough funds to complete the game, there are several features we would love to add but don't have the resources to do so. It's always been our dream to play a farming game that features changing seasonal outfits for NPC's, or finally, having kids grow up! We hope Kickstarter helps us realize some of the stretch goals we have for Coral Island.
As backers, we invite you to join our Discord to see daily developer diaries and have a direct open line of communication with us. 

Development began in October 2019. Initially, we focused on preproduction and coding core features that now serve as the foundation of Coral Island. Over the last 6 months, we've shifted gears into full production.  
Our focus right now is finalizing and polishing content for the Alpha that will be released to Alpha Farmer tier backers and above. From there, we'll work alongside the community, releasing two content updates and iterating feedback into the game before eventually launching into Steam's early access.

Press Kit | Discord | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram | Website | Wishlist on Steam 
Hi everyone, we are Stray Fawn Studio, creators of Niche - a genetics survival game and Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor. Both of our previous games were successfully developed and released with the help of Kickstarter backers like you, and we couldn’t be more excited to tell you about our new project: The Wandering Village!

The Wandering Village is a city building simulation game. In a world where mysterious plants are spreading all over the earth, emitting toxic spores as they grow, a group of people seeks shelter on the back of a giant, wandering creature they call ‘Onbu’.
Become their leader, build their settlement and form a symbiotic relationship with the creature to survive together in this hostile, yet beautiful post-apocalyptic world that now surrounds you.
Key Features
Build a village on the back of a giant creature
Farm various crops
Send out foraging missions to gather rare resources
Survive a variety of different biomes and events
Build a relationship with a giant and influence its actions
Ecology/Biology inspired gameplay
Unique blend of 3D and hand-drawn, hand-animated 2D graphics    

At its core, The Wandering Village is a city building and resource management game with rogue-like and survival elements. Farm various crops to keep your villagers fed, send out foraging missions to gather rare resources and scout the environment while constantly expanding the settlement. Of course, living on the back of a living, breathing beast comes with its own challenges, such as helping to maintain the creature’s health and building trust. This might even lead to the beast paying attention to your requests as it wanders through a variety of different biomes, each with its own perks and challenges, always trying to outrun the threat of the toxic spores.
In-game Screenshot
The ultimate goal, for both the humans and the creature, is to find a place where they can settle down and live in peace again. And if they don’t find this place, maybe they can figure out a way to fight back the plants and create it themselves.

Core Mechanics
Survival - Escape from the toxic spores and keep your villagers and the creature alive against ever-changing threats.
Symbiosis - Live both from and in harmony with the giant creature and form a relationship with it as you trek together through the post-apocalyptic world.
Building - Build an infrastructure where your people can live together, work together and survive together.
Farming - Plant, cultivate and harvest various crops to keep your villagers and the creature fed and healthy, or grow new kinds of resources.
Foraging - Send scouting parties to explore the different biomes surrounding you, discover rare resources and bring them back to your village, opening up new possibilities.
Help us grow our community and get noticed on Steam by wishlisting the game and following us on social media. We now reached 20'000 wishlists! An additional skin for Onbu, the giant creature, will be unlocked for everyone.
After we came up with the concept for the game, we first started thinking about the general look and feel of the game’s world and how it would affect gameplay. We quickly settled on a blend of painted 2D backgrounds and static assets and hand-animated 2D characters in a 3D world, since it combined the strengths of our team members, was easy to navigate in-game and just looked really charming in our opinion.
Initial world sketch.

The creature, ‘Onbu’, was probably the most important part of the process as it is both the map where the game takes place and a character in itself. We started with concepts that were pretty close to existing animals, but moved away from this approach over time as we wanted something that you could more sensibly build a village on. Thus, the designs slowly but surely evolved into our very own earthen fantasy creature, the ‘Onbu’.
Concept art of Onbu.
Process sketches of Onbu.

Onbu wanders through a post-apocalyptic world, which was the next part of our art-design process. We wanted this world to be a stark contrast to Onbu to emphasize that it is toxic, wild and uninhabitable. Onbu on the other hand should feel like an island, an oasis, the only thing that makes survival possible for the humans building the settlement on its back.
Concept art of the world.
Various sketches of the world.

Speaking of the humans, the first step in designing them was figuring out their scale, not only to make sense gameplay-wise, but also to be visible enough at any zoom level. As for the design itself, our goal was to make them look friendly, maybe even cute, but also to have them reflect that the world they live in is a dangerous one, which is why we gave them protective clothing.
Villagers as they appear in-game.
Process sketches.

Next were the buildings, which had to look functional while conveying both the original culture of the villagers and their adaptations to living in their new environment. They are constructed from simple materials, and since Onbu’s back is so high up and winds are strong, many of them are powered by wind energy. Colorful flags can often be seen attached to them as they are used to communicate with other villagers.
Concept art of farming buildings.
Process sketches of various buildings.

Various other species besides humans have survived the apocalypse. Most of these creatures are a mix between something familiar, like mammals, and something that seems alien, like giant insects. With this approach, we hope to achieve a result somewhere in the middle, ideally something that is weird, but kinda cute.
First sketches of other creatures.
Inspiration
Our main inspirations for the game were the evocative drawings of french artist Moebius and the works of Studio Ghibli, specifically Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind and Princess Mononoke.

The World
Mysterious plants are spreading all over the world, turning the ground toxic and infertile and the air unbreathable. No one knows what caused this, but the source has to be somewhere out there, waiting to be discovered.
The Human Settlers
Increasingly polluted air and failing harvests caused by the spores have driven the humans from their village. Many have died from hunger and exposure until they crossed paths with the giant creature. The remaining few managed to climb onto its back and start a new settlement.
In order to sustain themselves, adapt to their environment and grow stronger and smarter, they’ll need to harvest materials from the creatures’ body and its surroundings, while also making sure that the creature itself survives and keeps on walking, away from the spores and, hopefully, towards a safer place.
The village on the back of the giant creature.

The Gigantic Creature, “Onbu”
Onbu is the name given to the creature by the villagers.
   Before the toxic spores started spreading, it was sleeping for hundreds of years, buried in the ground, looking like a mere hill. But when the soil around it became toxic, it awoke from its long slumber and started to walk, trying to find a safe spot where it can go to rest again.
   But it is neither used nor adapted to travelling long distances, having gotten its nutrients from the ground for such a long time.

   At first, it doesn’t even notice the small creatures crawling around on its back. But soon, they start interacting with it, sometimes hurting it, but also providing it with food and keeping up its strength.
   Maybe they are different from other parasites.
   Maybe they can survive this together.
Onbu, the giant creature.

For the wandering village, he drew inspiration from various traditional folk music to bring the culture of the human settlers to life and immerse the player in the game’s world.

Since this is our third game on Kickstarter, we are fairly confident that we can deliver on our promises, as we did with our previous two campaigns.
However, game development can be unpredictable and delayed reward deliveries are always a risk. If the game feels unfinished, we prefer to continue working on it and delay its release until we are confident that you will enjoy the result.

updates.update_userinfo: Backer survey & Community goal reached
updates.update_content:
Dear Onbu riders

First of all, sorry for the late update!
Our plan was to send it out once the backer survey is ready but we ran into some problem with the setup. Now, we’re finally good to go :)
You all should receive an email from BackerKit with your survey link today (or yesterday if you were part of the test group). Please check your inboxes!


First: You don’t need to create a BackerKit account to fill out your survey. When you receive the email with the survey, click the link to respond. Answer the questions about your reward preferences and provide shipping information if needed.

After you respond to your survey, you can go back later and change your responses at any time before we close the survey.
If you need to review your information or pledge status, you can return to your survey by clicking the link in your survey email or requesting your survey link under "Lost your survey?" on our BackerKit project page at
If you used your Facebook credentials to log in to your Kickstarter account, the BackerKit survey is sent to the email address you use for your Facebook account. If you have another email address that you prefer to use, please contact support at .

For this campaign we're unfortunately not able to provide add-ons via BackerKit. We're sorry about that. We're still evaluating if we can set up a merchandise store in the future. We'll inform you if we have news on that front.

For backers who have the Architect, Explorer, Alpinist or Fawn Club Member tier: Your Steam keys for these games should be sent to you via email shortly after the survey got sent out. This might take another 24h.


We managed to reach the social goals of the campaign! So everyone who pledged for a game key or higher will receive an additional copy of the game for free :)

Those of you who jumped onto our already have seen that we’ve been hard at work with the game’s development and we will soon share some of the progress we made via backer updates too!
We hope to release ‘The Wandering Village’ into Early Access in Q4 2021. This release will be on Steam.

And finally for today, we’d like to give a to , an adorable game about farming, breeding and battling blobs! It’s currently in its last hours on Kickstarter.

Hero Mode - Plumb the depths of special randomized dungeons with your chosen party and take on unique challenges not found elsewhere in Allraan. Plan your team wisely, as certain members will be stronger against specific foes. Be careful though, because your party members will tire over time, making fights harder as you explore deeper into the unknown!
Asynchronous Mode - At this stretch goal, you will be able to share your party and fortress town as AI-controlled data with other players, allowing them to battle your army without you even being online.
Fortress Town Asset Pack - This set of visual assets will allow you to customize your fortress in the style of a Japanese or Chinese castle, setting you apart from the rest! This is the third piece of FREE Digital DLC for backers.
Battle Defense Mode - At this stretch goal, invaders will periodically attack your Fortress Town as the story progresses. Build a Citadel to strengthen your walls, train defensive troops and develop weapons to protect your citizenry from those that would ransack your home.
Another Story: Seign - In this DLC side story, you will take control of Seign in an adventure told from the empire's point of view.
Participate in this social game with your fellow Kickstarter backers to help rebuild the town and unlock unique rewards for all backers. 
How do you play this social game? Click here to learn more. 
Let's rebuild the town!
 Tier 1:
 Post Office Rank 3! 4 Character Stickers, a jumbo Key Art sticker and stickers for the 10 stretch goal characters added to the Painter Job! This building is fully upgraded!
   Cotton Mill Rank 3! Sleeve & back design and glow in the dark ink added to the T-Shirt reward! This building is fully upgraded!

  Tier 3:
 Painter’s Gallery Rank 2! Reversible cover unlocked for the physical version, JP and US covers available in all regions, and Bad Western Cover Art unlocked! This building is fully upgraded! 
 Music Hall Rank 3! A 2nd disc and Sound Effect & Remix album has been added to the CD soundtrack, an extra LP has been added to the Vinyl Reward! This building has been fully upgraded!
  Tier 4:

   Glass Blowing Factory Rank 4! A 2nd, 3rd, and 4th layer have been added to the acrylic diorama, and its size has been increased! This building is fully upgraded!
  Tier 5:
 Toy Shop Rank 2! Figures will now come packed with Special Edition Stickers & each figure box is now individually numbered!  Back the Kickstarter campaign. At 52,000 backers, the Toy Shop will be upgraded to Rank 3.

Eiyuden Chronicle’s deep story and dialogue is helmed by Yoshitaka Murayama, the master storyteller that wrote the scripts for both Suikoden I and II.
Watch the full town exploration video here:
PLAY

Eiyuden Chronicle has a vast world to explore, full of lush biomes, bustling towns, creepy caves, and quiet villages. Talk to townsfolk to learn more about the region, explore remote locations and fight secret bosses, or maybe just enjoy the gorgeous scenery.
The Waterstead of Quinja
The Seaside Cavern
Eiyuden Chronicle employs a traditional turn based RPG battle system where players take command of up to six individual units against either an army, or a single large creature. Choose commands for each of your characters, then watch them carry out your orders in full motion combat.
Watch the full boss fight video here:
PLAY

Over time, your heroes will also learn special AI abilities that they will perform on their own in battle, adding to the strategic element of combat. Characters will learn more AI commands as they grow stronger, and some characters will even link their AI commands together for added effects. Players will also be able to customize which AI commands their characters use in battle.
Through your adventures in the world of Eiyuden Chronicle, you will meet people from all walks of life, looking for something more. Whether it’s a fisherman, or a baker, or a brave warrior, each new addition to your army will bolster your ranks, making a worthy addition to your town.
Some of the kitties are very sleepy...
Eiyuden Chronicle isn’t just a classic-style JRPG. It’s also full of adorable cats. Cats as far as the eye can see. Cats meowing, cats napping, cats exploring the world. Cats, cats, cats. CATS! Meow!
This kitty looks like they're on patrol!
Music is an important aspect of JRPGs. This is why, in addition to internal composers, we’re also working with incredibly talented veteran composers.

Two copies of the epic JRPG for you and your cat, or on two different platforms of your choice, all to yourself.
For the old school gamer and collector alike, This boxed copy will both look great on your shelf, and house the game itself!
Two physical copies of the game, to do with however you wish. Want to give one to your cat? Want to put one in your collection and play the other one? Whatever you choose, this reward is for you.
This is your chance to get early access to the game, and not only take the battle system for a test drive before anyone else, but also offer your feedback to make it a better game! Due to logistical limitations, the beta will only be available on PC.
 A beautiful custom made button emblazoned with a sigil from the world of Eiyuden Chronicle.
The dulcet tones of Eiyuden Chronicle on physical CD, to enjoy whenever you like. Featuring music by Japanese music legends Motoi Sakuraba and Michiko Naruke.
A beautiful design straight from the world of Eiyuden Chronicle, screen-printed onto a T-shirt in the size you desire. 
Eiyuden Chronicle’s incredible JRPG soundtrack, etched forever into a limited edition collectible vinyl LP.

The art collector's dream, a hardcover book featuring unique behind the scenes concept and development artwork.
The Chef set comes with an apron, a set of digital recipes for delicious meals, and a measuring set to make sure each recipe comes out perfectly. 
The Painter set comes with a set of character stickers and a poster featuring art from the game.
The Jeweler comes with a selection of three beautiful Eiyuden-themed enamel pins with which to adorn your clothing.
The blacksmith set is a beautifully crafted 1:16 sized replica of the main character’s weapon, complete with a custom acrylic stand to display it on your shelf, your desk, or wherever you want!
The Farmer set comes with a beautiful tote bag to haul around whatever you like, and a journal to chronicle your daily adventures.
The Curator set features a multilayered acrylic diorama featuring the game’s main cast and the world of Eiyuden Chronicle.

Have your name featured in the game’s artbook as a staunch supporter of the Kickstarter campaign, forever cemented in the annals of history.
A beautiful poster featuring character art by Junko Kawano, and signed by the game’s four core members. Truly a collector’s item!
NOTE: The team reserves final say on creating these rewards, but we will make our best efforts to meet the backers’ expectations.
Name an in-game food ingredient. These items will appear in the game as ingredients for recipes, so let your imagination go wild!
Your name will be uttered by NPCs the player talks to in their travels. Will it be a congratulatory speech for your efforts on the battlefield, or will it be the eulogy at your funeral? That is for the cruel hand of fate to decide.
Hey, that's Komuta-san's kitty cat!
We know we said that Eiyuden Chronicle has more cats than you’ll know what to do with, but what’s one or two more? With this reward, you’ll be able to insert your adorable fur baby into the game, forever immortalized.
This very much not-a-cat is taking in the sun rays.
We don’t want other pet lovers missing out on all the fun. Don’t have a cat? That’s not a problem. Your little furry bundle of joy can still be a part of the world of Eiyuden Chronicle. 
The world of Eiyuden Chronicle is a vast one, but you can make a piece of it your own by helping us name a location in the world. Try to think of something cool.
Be a part of history by helping us design one of the many dark denizens that roam the land of Eiyuden Chronicle. Want to create a simple soldier, or a scary monster? The choice is up to you.
If you’d rather insert yourself into the game instead of your pet, we can do that too. Become one of the many people that live and breathe in the world of Eiyuden Chronicle. Become digitally immortal!
By adding $25 (2750 yen) on to your base pledge, you can add a beautifully woven 24"x18" cloth map of the world of Allraan to assist you through the dangerous world of Eiyuden Chronicle.
By adding $50 (5500 yen) onto your base pledge, you will get a set of five (5) premium Chibi-Chara figures.

Koji Igarashi worked with us at our last company, and wanted to offer his support for the project.
PLAY

You helped him on his campaign, and he has never been happier, and we want to learn which areas to be wary of so that we can make this a successful campaign that you can be proud to support.

campaign.story:
About
Hello! My name is Ashlee, better known on the internet as Dewdlepies. I create cute art and more recently, merchandise! 
This is my first ever Kickstarter project, with my first ever enamel pins, but I am no stranger to hosting a crowdfunding campaign! I have started and run campaigns for producing a number of products including stickers and acrylic charms.
This project is being run to fund the production of pins as I have no means to do so out of pocket! It is an all or nothing campaign, so you will not be charged until funding goals are met or exceeded, and the deadline has been reached. This  project will run for 30 days.
Pledging to this Kickstarter means the potential of unlocking designs and products, so every pledge counts! If you can't pledge, please share this project (if you can pledge, sharing still helps!)
Details
 UNLOCKED! 
First pin unlock will be the Emerald Carbie sticker and pin!
1.5" Black Nickle 
Hard Enamel
Emerald Carbie sticker is 4" x 3" and will be free with matching pin
Stretch Goals
Topaz Sticker (4"x 3") is free with matching pin
Topaz pin is 1.5" and black nickel metal. Hard enamel
Stackup Sticker (3.3" x 5") is free for those who pledge for 3 or more pins!
Ruby Sticker (2.7" x 3.5") is free with matching pin
Ruby pin is 1.5" with black nickel metal. Hard enamel
Cuddle Pile Sticker (4"x 4") is free for those who pledge for Moonstone or Obsidian pin. (1 sticker if pledging for both)
Obsidian Pin is approx 2" with gold metal. Hard enamel. 
The Carbie Friend Sticker (4"x 3.7") is free for those that pledge for 5 pins! 
Moonstone pin is approx 2" with silver metal. Hard enamel. 
More Stretch goals will be announced when the Kickstarter reaches beyond previous goals! 
Stretchier Goals! 
Alphinaud and Alisaie pins will be approx 2"
Both with black nickel metal. Hard enamel with silk screening
The Derpy Carbuncle pin is approx 1"with black nickel. Hard Enamel with silk screening
This pin is FREE with any 2+ pin pledge

campaign.story:
Every kid dreams about becoming a Temtem tamer; exploring the six islands of the Airborne Archipelago, discovering new species, and making good friends along the way. Now it’s your turn to embark on an epic adventure and make those dreams come true.
Catch new Temtem on Omninesia’s floating islands, battle other tamers on the sandy beaches of Deniz or trade with your friends in Tucma’s ash-covered fields. Defeat the ever-annoying Clan Belsoto and end its plot to rule over the Archipelago, beat all eight Dojo Leaders, and become the ultimate Temtem tamer!
The world of the Airborne Archipelago is filled with creatures, named by the locals as Temtem. Temtem have always been a part of day-to-day life on the islands. They live in harmony alongside humans, helping them with their chores or being loyal and faithful pets.
There's also a long tradition of taming wild Temtem and training them to fight in friendly battles against other tamers. In recent years, this has exploded in popularity due to a revolution in Temtem technology. Temtem scientists achieved the creation of the first Digital Temtem while studying new breeding techniques, and this has spurred the development of various commodities to help tamers on their adventures.
Every Temtem and every technique they know are assigned a specific type. Each type has strengths and weaknesses against other types so they are one of the most important things you need to think about when planning your Temtem squad. Each Temtem can have up to two types, but techniques can only have one type. There are 12 types in Temtem.
Temtem battles are the form of competition between tamers in the Airborne Archipelago. Tamers can have up to six Temtem in their squad, but only two at a time will be able to battle. In Temtem, battles are turn-based, so tamers will take turns commanding their Temtem what to do in battle until all Temtem are exhausted and one of the tamers emerges as the winner.
Battles are focused on 2v2 (although there will be some 2v1 battles against untamed Temtem or 1v1 battles with other players) and we’re committed to keeping random factors out of battles. We’ve seen the frustration that random elements cause, especially in the competitive scene, so we’ve decided to remove them and have made the combat 100% skill and strategy based.
Breeding is the method of creating new Eggs. Putting two compatible Temtem together will produce a new Egg, and from that Egg a new Temtem will be born! Breeding is the easiest way to create a Temtem with perfect stats, since they will inherit some of the stats of their parents. Breeding will also open the door to new movesets since some of the moves will be inherited, allowing a Temtem to know moves its species might not normally learn.
But don’t overbreed your Temtem! Each Temtem will have a genetic degradation value that will lower each time a new Egg is produced, so you can only breed a specific amount of times. Genetic degradation will also be inherited by the new Temtem, so you’ll need to plan beforehand how you’re going to spend the cycles.
Temtem features a fully fleshed-out story campaign. Journey across six vivid islands and embark on the adventure of becoming a Temtem tamer while fighting against the evil Clan Belsoto.
Online components of Temtem will be an addition to the adventure and will allow you to travel through the islands alongside other tamers and battle, trade, or talk with them.
The days of traveling solo are over; in Temtem the world is a massively multiplayer one. Tamers from around the world can join and you will be able to see them around you, living the adventure with you and fighting to become the best Temtem tamer. Chill with strangers, make new friends and battle them or trade your goodies; the dynamic online world is full of possibilities.
Temtem’s campaign will be fully co-op compatible. You will be able to join forces with a friend any time and work together towards your next goal. Catch new Temtem, complete a Route, or face off against a Temtem Leader; all while fighting alongside your friend in dual battles!
You’ve traveled over all six islands, you’ve caught every Temtem there is, you’ve trained the perfect squad and defeated all the Dojo Leaders. It looks like you need a well-deserved rest! Buy your own house at Atoll Row and decorate it your way. Buy new furniture, color your walls and you’ll be ready to invite your friends over!
Atoll Row is divided into neighborhoods, acting as instances, with persistent houses from all the tamers in the game. You’re going to be able to visit any house any time and inspire yourself with new ideas for your own house.
Customize your character to stand out from the crowd and get new cosmetics while you battle other tamers. Pick a silly hat, a comfy sweatshirt, some pants and you’re ready to go! Or maybe you prefer to wear a full-on cosplay of your favorite Temtem?
Temtem battles are the most important aspect of every new tamer’s job. Competitive battles take it up a notch and let you battle other tamers with similar skill levels. Begin to plan your strategy even before the battle with pick and ban phases and escalate the ranked ladders.
Start by choosing 10 Temtem and the pick and ban phase will begin. Take turns with your rival to pick your Temtem and ban theirs. When all the decisions are made and the turns are ended, you will end up with a squad of 4 Temtem and the battle will begin.
Welcome to the Airborne Archipelago, novice tamers!
These are the floating islands where Temtem and humans coexist peacefully. Each island is a whole different world, but there is something we all have in common – our love for Temtem and Temtem fighting! Intrepid tamers like yourself travel on airships to the furthest reaches of the Archipelago to find the best Temtem. Every young tamer dreams of becoming the best…
But not everything is fun and peace in the islands. Behind the scenes, Clan Belsoto is weaving a dastardly conspiracy against Temtem and humans alike. You will need all the friends and your best Temtem to defeat the wicked Clan Belsoto.
Deniz is a Mediterranean paradise of glittering seas where Water and Wind Temtem abound. Walk the streets of Turquesa, explore the ruins of an ancient fort or just chill on the shores of Indigo Lake.
Arbury’s pride is its University. The fierce dons of Lochburg swear by their Melee Temtem, against the sophisticated Properton academics, who favour Mind Temtem.
Omninesia (”the Myrisles”) is a cluster of tropical islets connected by rope bridges, home of Nature and Fire Temtem. Enjoy the luxury of Atoll Row and investigate the lava caves of the Anak volcano.
Cipanku dabbles in mysticism and well as technology. The labs of Nanto produce Digital Temtem, while the monks revere the Electric Temtem in remote hills among rice paddies.
Tucma, “The End of All Things” – a vast desolation of ashes, noxious lakes and Toxic Temtem. Under the surface, the mining city of Quetzal is home to artisans, rock-hoppers and Crystal Temtem.
Kisiwa is a sun-drenched savanna. Eastern Kisiwa boasts an unrivalled variety of Neutral Temtem, while the western deserts are home to the best Earth Temtem.
Clan Belsoto is a shady and enigmatic organization. Nobody knows who its true leader might be, but some of its captains are well-known:
Lady Lottie is an arrogant Arburian aristocrat, with the aloof manners of an exiled queen. Her delusions of grandeur conceal her dangerous skill in Temtem battles.
General X is a stern Denizan officer, fond of strict discipline and blind obedience. He is using Clan Belsoto to realize his own dreams of conquest and domination.
Dr. Hamijo is a disgraced Cipanki scientist, who now applies his knowledge to the advancement of the wicked plans of Clan Belsoto, using genetically modified Temtem when challenged to a duel.
Crema is a game studio based in Madrid, Spain. We’ve been making videogames for almost six years now and we’ve always been focused on delivering great gameplay experiences.
Our previous productions include:
Instant Buttons: Our first app, which to date has over 20 million downloads.
Oh My Goat: Featured by Apple and amassed over half a million downloads.
Ridiculous Triathlon: Also featured by Apple and publicly and critically acclaimed.
Immortal Redneck: Our first foray into the PC and console market, with over 94% positive feedback on Steam.
We’ll be working with the award-winning composer Damian Sanchez for all of the audio requirements of Temtem. Damian is an amazing composer who has worked on games like Rise & Shine, Reservoir Dogs: Bloody Days, and Blues and Bullets, and has become one of the most renowned composers in the Spanish gamedev community.
Damian has been working side-by-side with us on most of our games, and our collaboration with him goes back to 2015 when we were working on Ridiculous Triathlon. Since then he’s been our music guy for every project we’ve had, and most recently he’s been responsible for the awesome Immortal Redneck soundtrack.
As an exclusive reveal, you can now listen to the first theme on Temtem’s soundtrack:
Our company has been self-funded for almost 6 years while making our previous games, and now we have most of the funding for Temtem already on our arks. The Kickstarter will help just a bit on the financial side, but we especially want it for the community creation aspect. We really want to develop the game around the community and open the development.
With our previous game, Immortal Redneck, it became clear that we should have involved the community early on in development and not have waited for the game’s release to start receiving feedback. We made some assumptions that led to us not putting enough effort into certain areas of the game, and that ended up hurting the game’s perception by the public and got us off to a not-so-great start.
We want to change that, and Kickstarter is the perfect way to do it. We want our backers to be involved in the development, watch our day-to-day updates and provide feedback along the way. We plan to maintain an open development through our Discord server, especially with our Alpha Hero backers (and above) that will be testing the game from a very early stage and will help us shape the future of Temtem.
Lastly, since Temtem is very influenced by a well-known franchise, we aren’t really sure how positive the public reception is going to be. Kickstarter allows us to show the game to the public and gather feedback early on. We want to expand the well-known franchise and add features requested by its users for years, but we need to see if there’s enough interest in that before embarking on this massive adventure.
Since August 2017 when development began, we’ve been focused on laying the foundation of every aspect of the game and creating content for the Kickstarter campaign. We’ve been defining the pipeline for each area of development and we’re now ready to begin full production and start creating the final content for the game.
We’re currently focused on creating a first Alpha, and from there we plan to iterate with the community. The Alpha will feature the full first island, 30 Temtem, complete single-player mechanics (tamers, wild battles, catching and training Temtem, story, quests...), and basic multiplayer functionality (1v1 battles, chat, persistent online, seeing other players within the world…).
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 475+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $225MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter ever, but we’ve been developing games for over five years, and in that time we have delivered five games for different platforms with increasing scope and budget. Temtem is our biggest production to date, but we have the team and the expertise required to make it happen.

We are being realistic with our budget and time requirements and we’re very confident we will be able to deliver the really great experience we have in mind for Temtem. We’ve been working for several months now in order to create the foundation of the game, analyzing the development risks and planning everything.

The biggest challenge for us is going to be working with the community side-by-side from the beginning. We’ll do our best to hear all the feedback and incorporate it into the game, so backers feel like part of development.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

  Welcome to My Time at Portia, a 3D sandbox RPG adventure inspired by the beautiful aesthetic of Castle in the Sky and Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind. My Time at Portia features gameplay elements inspired by the likes of Harvest Moon, Stardew Valley, and the Animal Crossing series mixed with Dark Cloud 2 and Steambot Chronicles, while creating its own unique world set in the lush backdrop of what remains of an ancient civilization.
The team at Pathea has created an alpha demo which is free to download and includes 6-8 hours of gameplay. This is just a small taste of what we are looking to create for players who enter the land of Portia! 
                                          Steam        Itch.io        IndieDB        GameJolt
                This game came about due to our love for simulation RPGs. When we were brainstorming for this project, we wanted to make something like Animal Crossing mixed with Dark Cloud 2 mixed with Steambot Chronicles, since the release of Stardew Valley, probably add that in as well. We want to incorporate a lot of what made these games fun but also keep our own identity.
By pledging to any Steam tiers from $25 and up, you'll get access to the exclusive closed beta build on Steam the week after the Kickstarter ends.
  Setting sail for Portia, a town on the edge of civilization, you’ll arrive to find a workshop left to you by your Pa – a place where you can begin to craft a new life, using the relics from the past to improve Portia.  
Gather materials from Portia’s stunning open world: cut down trees, forage for herbs, mine in the ruins and even grow your own garden. There are many unique areas for you to explore including deserts, island, reefs, highlands, marshlands, mines and more! There are even two different types of dungeons including abandoned dungeons filled with important resources such as relics and ores for you to harvest or more hazardous dungeons where you’ll be able to encounter and battle monsters!
  The world at large is somewhat influenced by the likes of Castle in the Sky and Future Boy Conan. It’s got a dark background, an age after the apocalypse, but it’s a bright world, full of hope. There are enough bleak end of the world games out there already. We want this to be a family friendly game that anyone can play.  
The storyline will be deep and open. The player can choose which missions and commissions to take. There will be a lot that happens during the player’s stay in Portia. Every event will deepen the player’s understanding of the world as well as the town folks around him/her. The theme of the story is that people can overcome any adversity when they work together.  
We hope to give the player a truly memorable time in this game, of a warm and welcoming little town full of experiences.
        The world of Portia will feel alive as the villagers have their own unique behaviors and will go to school, do their jobs, work out, have fun and have their own stories to share with you. You’ll be able to befriend and romance the villagers within Portia.
      Workshop - The player inherits a workshop at the start of the game and has to collect resources and complete commissions to grow the workshop into the best in Portia. The workshop is the home space of the player, and many parts of it can be upgraded. The homestead can also be customized through placement of different furnitures and different room upgrades. 
Farming - Unlike most other farming games where you have to take care of your crops everyday, consuming lots of time and energy, the farming in this game will try to be more industrialized, more modern, such as using a planter box or semi-automatic irrigation systems. We want to keep the essential part of farming, such as planting your own crops and watching it grow, while taking out much of the daily routine associated with it to give the player more time to explore the world.    
Relationships - The player will able to befriend or romance most characters in the game. The relationships are tied together with the economy system. If a player has a good relationship with a certain NPC, there might be perks such as new missions, cheaper goods, or a willing hand. Going the romance route will allow the player to go on dates with the NPC, go through with a storyline for that NPC, and eventually marry that character.  
Character Customization - The player gets to pick to be male or female, with an assortment of hairstyles, facial styles, and colors to choose from. The face can be tweaked as well. There's even a barber shop in the game to allow for hairstyle changes.
Battle - The player will fight an assortment of monsters, robots, and baddies. Weapons and armor can be upgraded.
Skills - There is leveling in the game, skill points gained can be distributed by the player.
Marriage - When the player and NPC relationship reaches a certain threshold, marriage will become an option. After marrying, the NPC will become a helper in the workshop. There might also be some more storyline that happen after marriage. We’d like to add children to this game, with your support, we hope it's possible.
Abandoned Dungeons - procedural voxel based ruins where the player can dig up minerals and items from the ground. This uses smooth voxel technology to give the player a very seamless experience.  
Hazardous Dungeons - procedural based ruins with tough enemies inside. There might also be some platforming and puzzle solving involved. The Player will dig deeper and every few levels there will be a boss.  
Fishing - There are multiple spots to fish in this game, from the pristine rivers, to dark swamps, to tropical islands. The player will get to keep fish in a fish tank for viewing pleasure after a house upgrade. 
Mini-games - We’re trying to add in as many mini-games as possible. They will include darts, cross five, ranching, snow fight, etc. 
Holidays - There are several holidays and events that happens throughout the year in the game. From the Day of the Bright Sun where presents gets dropped from an airship; to the Day of Memories, where the town folks will set off lanterns and then play a game of hide and seek while dressed as ghosts; to the Martial Arts Tournament, where the player can show off some skills; and more.  
Storyline - The storyline will be deep and open. The player can choose which missions and commissions to take. There will be a lot that happens during the player’s stay in Portia. Every event will deepen the player’s understanding of the world as well as the town folks around him/her. The theme of the story is that people can overcome any adversity when they work together.  
Weather - The game has all the seasons as well as a full day night cycle with sunny days, rain, snow, cloudy, and overcast.  
Cooking - The game will have an elaborate setup for cooking. The player will be able to make many different recipes. The food can be sold, given as gifts, or eaten by the player.  
Animals - There are many different animals in the game world. Depending on time of day, weather, and seasons, different animals will appear. We'd like to add raising and riding animals to this game, with your support, we hope this is possible.
NPCs - Each NPC is unique in the game world. Everyone has their own personality, backstory, and habits. They follow their own schedules throughout the day. 
Sparring - The player is able to spar with most NPCs at any time. Some NPCs will love the fight while others will get sick of the sparring.
      My Time at Portia will release on Steam Early Access in January 2018. We’re aiming to release the full game during August of 2018. After that, it’ll be released on GOG, WeGame, Itch, and GameJolt. The PS4, Switch, and Xbox One versions will release in fall of 2018.

Re:Legend is a monster raising focused RPG with features such as farming, fishing, crafting, village building, multiplayer and more on PC!
 Washed ashore on Vokka Island without memories, you start a new life and find ways to recover your lost memories. However, you must first learn how to live on the island by cultivating the land, befriending villagers, expanding the village and raising your very own magical creatures known as Magnus. 
Venture around the land of Ethia where Vokka island resides to reclaim your memories, but this is no easy task as the world is filled with dangerous Magnus and threatening challenges. 
Re:Legend is heavily inspired by awesome games such as Rune Factory, Digimon World, Fantasy Life and Monster Rancher series. We love monster raising! <3
                                                    Taming and Raising Magnus  
Mythical creatures known as Magnus roam the land of Ethia, and every single one of them is tamable. They will aid you in many ways such as during combat, farming, fishing, traveling and more. They will also grow and evolve depending on your care, so each of them has unique evolution conditions. Once the Magnus has grown enough and you have gain their trust, you can mount them and use their abilities at will. These abilities will be helpful in your adventure in many ways so make sure to take good care of them!  
                                                                     Multiplayer
You can enjoy the game alone, but why not share the fun with your friends and family? Carry out the activities together and share precious memories!
Gameplay wise, there are plenty of activities that you can experience with your friends. One example would be farming, where you can split the workload between the players and everyone could master a specific part of the job. Different Magnus are better at different jobs, so each of the player can choose a different Magnus suited for different parts of farming. If having Magnus do your chores seems too cruel, you can always do it the traditional way by farming manually. Having friends will speed up the progress significantly.
Most of the features in the game are built around multiplayer so you will able to enjoy your friend's company throughout the game.
We believe that games are meant to be played together so we’re focusing on multiplayer since the early stages. These are just some of the features that have been confirmed and there’s still plenty of room for improvement as we are still experimenting with different ideas. More will be added in the future.  
Number of Players: 1 - 4
                                                                       Farming  
Vokka island’s fertile ground is perfect for crop cultivation, be it on land or underwater. You can plant plenty of crops all year long with different species of plants to be cultivated with each coming season. Each crop can be sold for gold or used to improve your progression in the game. Beside crops, you can also keep and breed the fish that you have caught around the world in your farm. You can let them swim freely in your farm!  
                                                                      Life Skills 
Practice makes perfect! You gain life skills as you practice them frequently. They level-up passively as you carry out the activities so it is crucial to practice the skill that you want to master as much as you can. Example of life skills: Mining, Fishing, Logging, Cooking, Crafting, Farming, Weaponry and much more! 
                                                                       Story
Waking up with no memory of your past, you will start your adventure to discover fragments of your memories that were scattered across the land. Each fragment will reveal more about your past and allow you to understand the world a little better. 
You will find more leads about your memories as you start to develop Vokka Village further throughout the game. People in the village will lend you a hand in uncovering your identity during your adventure so take your time to expand the village. Beside your memories, there's also more to discover as you explore the world!
                                                             Character customization
We feel that it's important for everyone to bring their own uniqueness to Re:Legend, especially because multiplayer is such an important part of the game. To make sure that everyone is special in their own way, you will be able to customize the character to your liking during character creation. Customizable parts will include hair style, hair color, eyes, pupil color, skin color, clothes and so on.
Armors can be used as vanity as well to mask over the current equipment that you are wearing. If you love how the armor looks but dislike the stats, just wear it as vanity and you will look exactly the way you want without affecting your stats. 
                                                  Building and Expanding Your Village 
Vokka Village is where your new life begins! Befriend local villagers and celebrate exciting festivals while having a good time together. Pay attention to their needs and help them out in their daily lives, and they will reward you accordingly. You can recruit more villagers into the village during your adventure, and having more villagers will expand the village. This will allow you to gain access to better resources, and who knows you might even develop a romantic interest in one of them?!
We believe that music is the soul of a game because it bring out best in it by triggering a player's emotion throughout their journey in the game world. In order to deliver the best experience for you guys, we're collaborating with none other than the legendary Video Game Orchestra(VGO)! Video Game Orchestra is a Boston-based ensemble that has recorded for huge blockbuster franchises like Final Fantasy and Kingdom Hearts (Square Enix) to Cytus (Rayark) and Mages of Mystralia (Borealys Games). Their recorded works have been nominated multiple times for Best Soundtrack within various circles, and is internationally renown for its quality and musicality.
Their experience and knowledge from those huge titles will be applied to Re:Legend so everything will be blended seamlessly from scene to scene. Audio will be extremely dynamic so you will be able to feel the exact mood of the specific game situation.

While Vokka Island is a peaceful and relaxing place, the outside world is definitely not! There are different regions around Vokka Island and each is a dangerous area filled with wild Magnus. It is always a wise choice to bring along your trusted Magnus before heading out.
We have planned 5 different regions so far and each of them will house unique Magnus in their respective ecosystem. There are plenty of exclusive Magnus in those regions that cannot be encountered in other regions where the region’s exclusive Magnus has different strength in terms of their abilities and growth. They will be able to help you in specific sections of your journey so take your time to understand their strengths and raise them carefully.
The direction that we are aiming for is a combination of cute and cool so we went with the chibi anime style. We hope that you will enjoy what you see!  
We're spending a lot of time taking the monsters from 2D concept art to 3D assets since we want to create a unique feel for the monsters, ranging from distinct physical features to special interaction animations.
Here’s some of the sample concept that we have developed, enjoy!
Re:Legend's concept was conceived around December 2015 and we were actually half way through the development. Back then the project had another name and we had poured so much time and effort into it that some of us had our health crippled. But in the end, it was cancelled due to our investor's financial difficulties and more than a year worth of effort was flushed down the drain and destroyed before our very eyes. That was the darkest time of our life and all of us were so lost that we had no idea what to do anymore.
Shortly after the cancellation of the previous project, we put a lot of thought into it and we decided that we had ventured too far to give up on the game, especially after it became one of the top Square Enix Collective projects. It would have been a shame to disappoint those who had taken their time and voted for us during the campaign―it is thanks to them that Re:Legend exists today. 
We strove to achieve the same result we had with our previous project ever since, and to our delight, Re:Legend is currently the best supported project in Square Enix Collective's history. In fact, we didn't just meet our goal but surpassed it several times over. To everyone who voted for us, you guys are really awesome! We couldn't have made it without your help.
After the major success of our Square Enix Collective campaign, we realized that Re:Legend has huge potential and we want to make it the best it can be. Expectations were really high from you guys and we figured that it would be impossible for our tiny team to fulfill them. This is why we're starting this campaign: To realize the full potential of the game!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Game development is always full of unknowns and unexpected events are occurring on a daily basis. Lucky for us, we're very used to solving challenges that may come our way effectively. Our team has been solving challenges since Day 1 of the development, be it technical or real world issue. We have been through many hardship and we are not giving up no matter what is thrown at us.

But of course nothing is set in stone until it happens so there are still things that we might not be able to solve or prevent such as natural disaster, health problem, robberies, cyber attacks and what not. Nonetheless, we will do our best to minimal the risk as we continue the development.

Last but not least, thank you for believing in us and joining our adventure to make Re:Legend a reality! Let's do this together.

campaign.story:
GLITCHED is a mystery and exploration RPG coming to PC, Mac, and Linux. The game features traditional turn-based combat with a little bit of spice but will primarily focus on the story and how you change it. This will be done through the ESSENCE SYSTEM, which will track a player's personality and morality. After a glitch appears in the world of SOREN, our unexpected hero, Gus, will become aware of you- the player. Experience fourth wall breaking shenanigans while making decisions that will shape this world. 
We are funded!
Thanks to all of our backers! GLITCHED is now funded and will begin development as soon as the Kickstarter is over! 
If you cannot back through Kickstarter, use our Paypal to pre-order GLITCHED. You'll be able to pre-order GLITCHED for $10 and have the option for a few of our backer rewards as well. This will go down once our Kickstarter campaign is over! But be aware that any money given via Paypal will not reflect on the Kickstarter page total.
If you haven't backed us yet, check out our stretch goals to help add content to GLITCHED! 
   GLITCHED is being developed by En House Studios, a Chicago-based game dev team. Instead of wasting your time reading this introduction paragraph, you could be playing a demo of GLITCHED now.
(Like right now.)
     NOTE: This is a demo prototype of the game. It reflects an early development cycle and you can expect changes and improvements to a final version. This version will have some bugs which we will work to fix as soon as possible. We recommend 2 GB of free ram in order to run GLITCHED. A Linux version will be available for the final release only, sorry!
  The small town of BETWIXT sits far removed from the events of the rest of the world and has always been home to GUS, our unlikely hero. 
Things remained ever constant until one day his best friend, CONRAD, told him he was going to leave for strange reasons.
On the night before CONRAD departs, an unexplained phenomenon, the glitch, seemingly erases his existence from the world. After coming face to face with the glitch, GUS is able to interact and speak to you- the player of GLITCHED. The traumatic event of suddenly losing his friend significantly affects GUS, but luckily you’ll be there to guide him through.
Together, you and GUS will explore the world of SOREN and discover the truth behind it all. Each choice you make might influence who decides to be your friend or foe   
You’ll travel from crowded cities to ancient kingdoms. Remnants and tales of the past will lead you to the answers of the present.
You're bound to meet plenty of strange characters on your journey. Some will be friends and other foes- perhaps that choice is left up to you.
  At its core, GLITCHED is a story driven RPG where the player is constantly making decisions that have an impact of the world of SOREN. 
In GLITCHED, the ESSENCE SYSTEM will track a player's choices and shape their personality and morality. This system will give each player a unique experience. 
By exploring the world in your own way, you’ll generate points towards six different ESSENCE alignments. 
These alignments serve as personality types which will impact characters, story and the world around you. Your interaction with NPCs, how you explore the environment, combat, and even your conversations with GUS will determine your ESSENCE.   
Each ESSENCE focuses on certain character traits and ideologies. No ESSENCE is good or evil, but instead explains the reasons behind your actions. Through meeting and talking to different NPCs, you’ll get a better idea of what each ESSENCE is about. 
  GLITCHED uses traditional turn based combat with a few twists:
There is no leveling or random monster encounters.
All combat is story based and players will be making choices that may or may not lead to a brawl.
Leveling up and experience are also removed. 
Players will have to use different party members and equipment in order to change how they approach each battle.
Deciding to kill, spare, or find another way to stop a fight will all lead to different story outcomes.
Actions in battle are limited to three types: Fighting, Interacting, & Goodies. When enemies cannot fight anymore you'll be able to choose to kill or spare them which will alter the story. 
You might also choose to interact with your enemy to resolve the conflict in a different way . Lastly, you'll be able to use items in battle to bring about various effects.
Check out our stretch goals section to see possible additions to the features of GLITCHED. There are plenty of things to be added, but prioritizing main game play features in the demo means smaller additions did not find their way in.
  The soundtrack for GLITCHED features music composed by our very own Justin Hilton. Our friend Stijn Van Wakeren also composed a few songs and produced all of the tracks for the demo. Check out more of his work here. Visit the GLITCHED Soundcloud for more tracks here or check out the Band Camp to purchase some of the songs here.

                                                                  Kinda Lost
                                                            Slick Like Green Skin
                                                     Composed by Stijn Van Wakeren
                                                                  Safe & Sound
                                   We kept backer rewards as simple as possible. Each tier includes all previous rewards. The early bird special includes the full game, the soundtrack, and the dev book for $10 but is only for the first 75 backers.
                                          ⋆ STRETCH GOALS ⋆
  Customize a hub town! You’ll be able to pick and choose the layout, buildings, and residents. A quiet (or noisy) place for you and your friends to kick back.
Bebo's are our lovable flightless birds. As a species, they are quite infatuated with Gus. As you traverse the world, you’ll run into all different sorts of them. As any good RPG would have you do: it’s time to collect them all.
Put your number crunching to the test against a series of turn based combat trials. You’ll be able to build an arcade in your hub town which will include boss rush modes, new game play, and more.
Our pixel portraits for each character could use a little love, and with this stretch goal you’ll get two upgrades for the price of one. First, each character will get a nice little talking animation to go along with their speech. Second, each character will get a full sheet of emotions to help bring conversations to life just a bit more. 
Let’s get those enemy sprites movin’ and groovin’. With this stretch goal we’ll add enemy animations along with some animation to the character cards for your allies. Making the battles just a bit more lively might help during some of those longer encounters.
This stretch goal will encompass quite a lot of content. We can’t give away too many details about additions to the game, but you can expect more hours of game play at this stretch goal. This will add things like new places to explore, new quests and characters, new equipment, and more branching stories. At this funding level, we’ll be able to create our ‘dream game’ without leaving content out that we really wished to see in the full release.
GLITCHED already has tons of replay-ability with the Essence System, but with New Game+ you will challenge tougher enemies, uncover hidden secrets, and more to reward players who want to experience everything. More details will come once it's unlocked! 
The friendship system will allow your party members to interact with one another. They will gain points being in the party together and learn tag skills in battle. More character backstory and cool skills await with the friendship system!
New quests and characters come along with the day and night system. You'll be able to wait or use an inn to cycle the time of day. Different quests and characters will be available during different parts of the day. More secrets and complex quests!

With this stretch goal, all backers will receive free additional content after release. The nature of the DLC we want to keep hidden to avoid spoilers, in total there will be an additional 10-25 hours of content with this stretch goal- free to all backers!

A sizable chunk will go to backer rewards. Our development costs can be seen by adding art, soundtrack, licensing, and graphic design together. These all add up to fifty percent of the total. Art will go towards paying our pixel artists and promotional artists. Soundtrack will go towards producing our compositions. Kickstarter fees and taxes will take about ten percent. What’s left will be spent on promotion which gets us to our full budget.   
This budget changes in the event that we earn more than our asking amount. We’ll update this little pie chart if that does happen to keep you informed on where your money will be going. We wish to be transparent on how we will use these funds and will answer ANY possible question you have about spending. We take development costs very seriously and believe open communication is important to crowdfunding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter is a risk. What we have tried to do is showcase not only our serious dedication to the project, but also that we have the skills, means, and environment to develop GLITCHED. We hope that our Kickstarter and demo has provided you enough confidence to consider backing us.

With that said, game development has its risks. There are everyday risks such as health, family, and life issues that might happen to anyone. Development risks are where most problems arise. For us, this means extended deadlines, delayed development, or the feared "running out of funds." We have taken a look at the necessities for GLITCHED and have carefully based our budget around that. With more money behind the project comes more security, content, and quality. Our main goal is to deliver GLITCHED. We have estimated a release date of February 2018 but the stated risks could possibly change that.

We have laid out our case in this Kickstarter. We have the ability to produce GLITCHED and our demo shows a taste of what the final product will look like. We hope you understand the risks that might happen down the road but also take a look at what we have done to earn your trust in us. We believe greatly in transparency and there will be nothing that happens in development which we don't relay to you.

Niche is a mixed genre game about the scientific topic of population genetics. Shape your animal tribe and find an ecological niche for it to live in! The main goal is to keep your tribe alive against all odds, such as hungry predators, climate change and spreading sickness.
         Thank you so much for checking out our Kickstarter! The animal species in Niche is very adaptive and will react to things that happen in this campaign. Influence their evolution with your actions!
  With Niche we want to create a game that gives you tons of different approaches to tackle mother natures challenges of survival. Develop great camouflage and sharp senses to detect predators early and hide. Become super strong and shred all attackers with your horns and claws. Why not become toxic to eat and poison whoever tries to take a bite? Try to spread your species across all islands and prove how adaptable you are. We believe that this game will be a great joy for everyone who loves biology, animals and evolution. Let's make it a reality!
  To get an impression of the game, check out this Let's play by Fork:
If you'd like to try the latest demo of the game, join our playtester group on Facebook. Don't use Facebook? Send us an email.
  Creatures: We love the Creatures series. Their approach of simulating a species as well as families in unmatched. The fact that your animals age and are mortal deepens your relationship with them and makes their lifetime valuable.

Spore: Niche and Spore share the genetics and evolution topic. We are mainly inspired by the first two episodes of Spore (when you start off in the water and when you start building your tribe on land).
Don’t Starve: The big, procedural worlds of Don't Starve shaped our vision of Niche's environment. Wandering, running and migrating through different habitats, each with it's own challenges and inhabitants is what brings our worlds to life.
  When playing Niche, your main objective is to inhabit all island of the world. If all your animals die, the species is extinct which means the game is over.
In order to be prepared for the next island's dangers, it's important to build up a big enough tribe. Mating is based on real genetics, featuring dominant, recessive and co-dominant heredity. 
Your babies grow up fast! Animals grow old and will die of old age. So make sure to produce offspring and keep an eye on your gene pool.
